New Records: Madushanka-Theekshana partnership registered Sri Lanka’s highest 10th wicket partnership in a World Cup match.
Key Match Events: Daryl Mitchell scored crucial runs including a six and several boundaries.
Tim Southee and Trent Boult took key wickets early in the innings.
Kusal Perera scored the fastest 50 in this World Cup.
Rachin Ravindra took the final wicket to end Sri Lanka's innings at 171.
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand needed to win to cement its place in the semifinals.
Lockie Ferguson returned to the New Zealand XI after recovering from an achilles injury.
There was an 80% chance of rain which could have affected the match.
Post-Match Reflections: New Zealand virtually sealed their spot in the semifinals with this win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru.
The weather was cloudy and humid with a high chance of rain.
